transcription:
‘Frank tries fish’ or ‘Remembrance’
 
 It never was my forte, dear, but brave as I can be
 I’ll take the fish with roti, dear, with rage I will not seethe.
 And as I cut the fish in two, the sauce I will allot
 Harkens to exciting roomies’ sauces I forgot.
 /
 This poem is about religion! Ooh –
 
 verse from a zealot mouth
 like blush upon a snout
 a billion naval ships
 amassed in tow like spawn of fish
 or flowers an azalea
 with no word with no desire
 but to burn a bush on fire
 and the choir of clover
 sings until its over
